previous.excerpt:
Hello!

I went through all the hot posts in popular sub-reddits and selected the top
posts for the week. I excluded GME, NOK, AMC because I'm sure everyone is
experiencing fatigue at the moment on why ThE SquEeZe iS nOt SqUoZe. You might
think this is very subjective to what I think is "popular" or…
previous.title: Tired of hearing about GME, AMC, & NOK? I handpicked the most popular posts, tickers, and DD from the last week. Here are the results!

localize.title: 听腻了GME、AMC和NOK？我精心挑选了上周最受欢迎的文章、股票和DD。以下是结果

认为这是非常主观的，我认为什么是 "流行 "或... ...

next.excerpt:
Not sure if the title explains exactly what I mean but I'm always intrigued
about the psychology behind people who prefer to buy dead beat companies because
the price is low rather than the companies of tomorrow because the price is
high.

It's a pretty simple decision when you think about it right?…
next.title: The psychology behind buying dead beat companies because the price is low vs the companies of tomorrow because the price is high.

localize.title: 因为价格低而买入死拍公司与因为价格高而买入明日公司的心理。
localize.the_new_excerpt:
不知道标题是否能准确地解释我的意思，但我总是很好奇。
关于人们喜欢购买死气沉沉的公司背后的心理，是因为
价格低，而不是明天的公司，因为价格是。
高。

你想想看，这是个很简单的决定，对吧？...

localize.title: 因爲價格低而買入死拍公司與因爲價格高而買入明日公司的心理。
localize.the_new_excerpt:
不知道標題是否能準確地解釋我的意思，但我總是很好奇。
關於人們喜歡購買死氣沉沉的公司背後的心理，是因爲
價格低，而不是明天的公司，因爲價格是。
高。

你想想看，這是個很簡單的決定，對吧？...
